title: Bug 5340 - Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect
OB: When adding an exception breakpoint, the progress dialog closes immediately and the exception list comes up. However, if the user cancels the process, the cancellation request is ignored and the progress dialog still closes.
EB: The software should honor the cancellation request when adding an exception breakpoint. It should either stop the process and keep the progress dialog open, or disable the cancel button.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the software
2. Navigate to the exception breakpoint settings
3. Add a new exception breakpoint
4. When the progress dialog appears, click the cancel button
